definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: I’m the black sheep of my family, in that sense, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点上说，我可能是家族的叛逆者，”她说。

sentences.english: In the rebel s universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡颂扬不公。

sentences.english: In the rebels universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡颂扬不公。

sentences.english: Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers.
sentences.chinese: 社会表扬活著的顺服者，以及死去的叛逆者。

sentences.english: Amrita becomes a bold, daring rebel…
sentences.chinese: 阿姆里塔成了一个勇敢无畏的叛逆者。

sentences.english: But a certain dreadful expectation of judgment, and the rage of a fire which shall consume the adversaries.
sentences.chinese: 只有一种等待审判的怕情，和势将吞灭叛逆者的烈火。

sentences.english: Li, with her tattoos and dyed hair, is regularly referred to in China as a rebel.
sentences.chinese: 有纹身且染发的李娜在中国常常被认为是一个叛逆者。

definition: to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
see 桀驁不馴|桀骜不驯[jie2 ao4 bu4 xun4]
